text:
Hey guys,

What the easiest method to creating a deal that has an associated contact and company based on the following:

Contact Submitting form has an interest in Company A

Deal needs to be associates to form submission contact and to Company A

I can see the API resource for creating the deal but what’s the best method to return the contact VID and company VID (based on domain)?
Hi, working on a site with a knowledge base and I wanted to ask, does the search facility only relate to this section and not the entire site?

If l get it right you have added the search functionality on your knowledge base and you are not sure if it searches the knowledge base page only or it will search the entire site. 

By default the search module will search the entire site content..
Thanks for your reply. Yes that's correct. Great I'll take a look at the default search module and see if it picks up the Knowledge Base content.
Unfortunately the site search wasn't finding the KB content. Was worth testing though, thanks again :+1:
Is your KB content coming from HubDB?
No, it's part of the HubSpot Service <https://www.HubSpot.com/products/service/knowledge-base>
See the CRM Associations API :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey All,

With close to 100 responses :tada: on our survey so far, we are filled with warm feelings on the responses we’ve received (we read them all, so dont think your messages go unnoticed) and we are also pumped about all ideas/feedback we’ve gotten!

Your feedback means the world to us and we just wanted to ask those of you who haven’t had the chance yet, if you could please *take a quick 5 mins to complete the survey about this slack?*

:point_right: <http://bit.ly/hsdevslack>

As mentioned, we’ll be using your responses to help make this Slack the best it can possibly be in 2020 and we really appreciate you taking time out of your day :slightly_smiling_face:

<https://gph.is/19CpRiF>

Hi all. Weird question here. Has anyone ever used smart tokens to dynamically update email styling? For example, if we had a hex code for company branding color, use that to style the color of a header bar at the top of the email?
Is it not possible for the highlighted functionality for lists for deals criteria? I see this criteria for a date field in the contact record, but I don't see this functionality in deals or contacts.
Hi, is it possible to have  cta link to an anchor in a landing page in HubSpot?
Yes, but not without reloading the page due to the the tracking url
ok so no smooth scrolling to a certain area of a page then :disappointed:...?

Remington is correct, you wouldnt be able to do a smooth scroll with link tracking and it would require a page refresh.

You could use google event tracking and do a normal (non cta) link with an onclick event for it though as a means of tracking.
ah ok thanks !!

Hey guys, just joined today! I was wondering if its possible to implement a form similar to this one: <https://www.modsy.com/project/room> using HubSpot? I want to be able to track each click the user makes thorugh URL params. Can something similar be done using HubSpot? Thanks!
<@U22PJPGK0>? (not sure who to ping about this)
Hmm, definitely not my area of expertise. Maybe <@U2H3TT8F2> can confirm.
thx
Im not sure off hand but let me ask around internally and see about this for you Remington. Ill update you when I hear something

Hi there Danyal, yes it is possible to implement a form like this. The standard HubSpot form embed code alone would not get you all the way there, you will need to do a fair amount of customization.

There are a few paths you can take, the easiest for re-creating this specific style of form would probably be to use radio buttons and checkboxes for the room fields and whatnot, and normal email and name fields for the contact fields.

Build the form html as you see fit and then use javascript to on submit of the form, submit the values via the forms submission API <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3>

I’m sure others here have some great solutions to, so please share them if you guys have done something similar.
Thank you so much! I’ll look into the method you suggested.
<@URTG1V005> yes its possible, I have built this form before <https://www.just-dm.co.uk/judgments-for-money>
